message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CE. 

The paper deals with item recommendation algorithms, which are commonly studied in the information retrieval (IR) community, hence cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses evaluation metrics, which are relevant to machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) research, hence cs.LG and cs.AI are also likely sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of sampling to speed up computation, which is a common technique in data science (DS), hence cs.DS is a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the inconsistency of sampled metrics, which is relevant to the field of computational engineering (CE), hence cs.CE is a possible sub-category.
